title: process_10x_auto
description:
Map all 10x Fastq files in a directory.

Steps in the workflow:

  * Look for all `*.fastq.gz` files in the `input_dir` which
    match the regular expression in `fastq_regex`.
  * Extract the sample id from the path name using the same `fastq_regex`.
  * Write the list of samples as a yaml in the output directory.
  * Map the reads using Cell Ranger
  * Convert the Cell Ranger output to h5mu
  * Remove ambient RNA with CellBender
  * Remove cells with less than 100 genes or 1000 reads.
  * Make the cell names unique
  * Output one h5mu file per sample

Concatenating the invididual h5mu files into one h5mu file is a separate pipeline.

input directory.title: Input directory
input directory.description:
Arguments related to how to search for `".fastq.gz"` files inside the 
input directory. Only files matching the `fastq_regex` are retained.

input_dir.description: A directory containing one or more 10X samples.

fastq_regex.description: Only files matching this regular expression will be retained.
fastq_regex.help_text:
Only files matching this regular expression will be retained.
For more details on the notation of regular expression, see the 
Java Docs on [Regular expressions](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html).

sample_id_replacement.description: Which groups from the fastq regex to use as the sample ID.
sample_id_replacement.help_text:
Which groups from the fastq regex to use as the sample ID. 
For example, if the `fastq_regex` is `"(.*)_S[0-9]*(_L[0-9]*)_R[12]_001.fastq.gz`,
and the fastq file is `"foo_S002_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz`, setting the 
`sample_id_replacement` to `"$1"` results in the sample ID being `"foo"`, while
with `"$1$2"` the sample ID would be "foo_L001".

reference.title: Reference
reference.description:
The reference to map the reads to. Ideally, this reference was created with the
[Make reference](https://openpipelines.bio/components/workflows/ingestion/make_reference.html)
pipeline in OpenPipelines.
The path to Cell Ranger reference index. This input can be either a `.tar.gz` file
reference.help_text:
The path to Cell Ranger reference index. This input can be either a `.tar.gz` file
or a directory. Using a directory will be slightly faster.

output directory.title: Output directory
output directory.description:
The resulting h5mu will be stored in the `publish_dir`. This workflow will 
replicate the same folder structure of where the fastq files were found relative
to the `input_dir`.

output_raw.description: Which template to use to define raw output directories.

output_h5mu.description: Which template to use to define h5mu output directories.

params_yaml.description: The filename for the param list yaml.

operational arguments.title: Operational arguments
operational arguments.description: Arguments related to the operational side of the pipeline processing.

dry_run.description: If passed, will only generate the param_list.yaml file.
